thread.title: See Martin Garrix, Dua Lipa Perform Viral 'Scared to Be Lonely' on 'Fallon'
thread.title_full: See Martin Garrix, Dua Lipa Perform Viral 'Scared to Be Lonely' on 'Fallon'

title: See Martin Garrix, Dua Lipa Perform Viral 'Scared to Be Lonely' on 'Fallon'
text:
Martin Garrix and Dua Lipa performed their collaboration "Scared to Be Lonely" on The Tonight Show With Jimmy Fallon on Wednesday night. Lipa will be releasing her self-titled debut album in June. Related Watch Troye Sivan, Dua Lipa Cover Mark Ronson's 'Somebody to Love Me' Pair performed the Boy George-led track while touring together this fall 
Before the performance, Fallon noted how well the single has been doing, having been streamed over 250 million times since its January release. Garrix and Lipa then took the stage, with the EDM DJ and producer playing guitar as Lipa belted out the subdued, vulnerable opening verse of the song. When the first drop hit after the chorus, turning the song into a euphoric dance track, Lipa headbanged and danced around the stage while singing to a guitar-strumming Garrix. 
The 21-year-old Lipa has been releasing singles for her debut LP since 2015, including the hit singles "Be the One" and "Hotter Than Hell." Last year, she collaborated with Sean Paul on "No Lie" and opened for Troye Sivan on his North American tour. Garrix released his third EP, Seven , last October and had a hit with the Bebe Rexha-sung single "In the Name of Love." More News
